results.title: Glimpses of Australia. [No. 02?]
results.brief_description: Cinemagazine items include: 1. A lesson in geography - shows the size of Australia in relation to Scandinavia and Europe. 2. Warburton District - located on the Great Dividing Range, Victoria, shows scenery and inhabitants. 3. The Princes Highway - from Lakes Entrance to Narooma inlet. Shows Lakes Entrance locals and holiday-makers; an Aborigine fishing with a spear; Narooma’s beautiful inlet; oyster fishing and eating. 4. Animal bandits - animals dance to the sound of birds; they form a band but their tunes are unbearable until they attend Professor Heron’s school of music.

results.title: [Kodak Cinegraph compilation. No. 05]
results.brief_description: A compilation of silent newsreels including: 1. Coronation of (probably) King George V. 2. The tribute of the forest - The ‘Hoop Pine’ of Queensland used for making matches and butter boxes. An example of the “winch and steel cable” method (?) - logging in Queensland. Bullock teams also shown hauling logs. 3. Burton Holmes’ Film Reels of Travel - alpine vistas. 4. Alfred Weiss presents ‘Another kick coming’. 5. Sheep dipping and general farm scenes. 6. Granite Quarry in action. 7. Steel production.

results.title: Autumn: a concept film
results.brief_description: A short experimental film which focuses on one tree as it loses its leaves during the autumn season. We watch until finally the last leaf falls and the tree is completely bare. Without commentary but accompanied with music. No other credits available.

results.title: Wildflower Wonderland
results.brief_description: Informational travelogue on the Grampians National Park focussing mainly on the diversity of flora in and around the area and interspersed with scenes of people bushwalking some of the well-known tracks available.

results.title: Copyrites
results.creator_credit: Kim Mordaunt, Cathy Eatock, Film Finance Corporation Australia and Australia. Special Broadcasting Service
results.brief_description: This program poses questions about what happens when Aboriginal concepts of ownership meet Western copyright laws in terms of Aboriginal art, its exhibition and distribution both nationally and internationally. Viewed as central to the lives of Aboriginal people, the art works elucidate a connection to the land and the vital importance of Aboriginal community, cultural and historical traditions. When these forms of expression are illegally reproduced and manufactured the consequences for the artists and the community at large loom further than the Western concept of violation of copyright, an issue that this documentary explores in depth.

results.title: With Grandma
results.creator_credit: Francoise Hartmann and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The initial fears of leaving mum and dad behind quickly disappear as dress ups, photographs of grandma as a young girl, games, special food and stories appear that only a grandma can provide as the generation gap between a young girl and an older woman is bridged. A lyrical look, without words, at the shared experiences of a young girl visiting with her grandmother.

results.title: Train control
results.brief_description: Shows how the movements of trains on the New South Wales railway system are controlled to ensure smooth running and prevent accidents. When the system has been explained, its working is illustrated by tracing the journey of a goods train from one point to another.

results.title: Zoo Olympics
results.creator_credit: Picha, Eric Van Beuren, Francis Nielsen, Y C Alligatorfilm and Rooster Studio
results.brief_description: Drawn by French animator Picha, here are 26 episodes of the hilarious animal Olympics antics. These are parodies of Olympic events, based vaguely on behaviours in the animal kingdom, such as egg laying and rolling (chickens), slop slurping (pigs) and kangaroo boxing.
